questions.text: Which Cornish village is the legendary birthplace of King Arthur?
In the UK sitcom 'Dad's Army', What did ARP Warden Hodges nickname Captain Mainwaring?
What was the nickname of the famous Portuguese football player, Eusebio?
In 'Monty Python's Life of Brian' (1979), who plays Brian?
Who has children called Honey Kinney, Betty Kitten and Harvey Kirby?
Diana Coupland, star of 1970's sitcom 'Bless this House', backed her ex-husband as the arbitrary composer of the James Bond Theme Tune. Who is he?
'The Joshua Tree' was a U2 album. Which part of the world does this tree-like desert yucca plant with greenish-white flowers, belong to?
Al Capone had six men of one of his rivals gunned down in the St. Valentine's Day Massacre. Which rival was it?
Whose book, to be published in April (2001) is called 'Sink or Swim'?
Who said,'A diplomat is someone who can tell you to go to hell and leave you looking forward to the trip?
questions.explanation:
Alex Salmond (politician).

	Former leader of the Scottish National Party. Hope you enjoyed the quiz
